webwork-tex.statement: Suppose \(\vec{F}(x,y) = \langle 2y, -\sin(y) \rangle\) and \(C\) is the circle of radius \(9\) centered at the origin oriented counterclockwise. \leavevmode\\\relax \leavevmode\\\relax (a) Find a vector parametric equation \(\vec{r}(t)\) for the circle \(C\) that starts at the point \((9,0)\) and travels around the circle once counterclockwise for \(0 \leq t \leq 2\pi\). \leavevmode\\\relax \(\vec{r}(t) =\) \mbox{\parbox[t]{20ex}{\hrulefill}} \leavevmode\\\relax \leavevmode\\\relax (b) Using your parametrization in part (a), set up an integral for calculating the circulation of \(\vec{F}\) around \(C\). \leavevmode\\\relax \(\displaystyle \int_C \vec{F} \cdot d \vec{r} = \int_a^b \vec{F}(\vec{r}(t)) \cdot \vec{r}\,'(t) \, dt = \int_a^b\) \mbox{\parbox[t]{20ex}{\hrulefill}} \(dt\) \leavevmode\\\relax with limits of integration \(a =\) \mbox{\parbox[t]{5ex}{\hrulefill}} and \(b =\) \mbox{\parbox[t]{5ex}{\hrulefill}} \leavevmode\\\relax \leavevmode\\\relax (c) Find the circulation of \(\vec{F}\) around \(C\). \leavevmode\\\relax Circulation = \mbox{\parbox[t]{10ex}{\hrulefill}}
